item.title: Report E-2025030371
item.description:
Report E-2025030371

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-21
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 3149On March 21, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN3149 were crushed in transit and released approximately 1.5-gallons of product to the trailer interior and surrounding freight. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report X-2025031110
item.description:
Report X-2025031110

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-20
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while the ABF driver was attempting to delivery the commodity the customer unloaded the freight onto the dock and before the ABF driver was able to depart from the location the customer handed him a black trash bag and stated that one of the boxes was damaged. ABF advised that the bo x appeared to be crushed and does not know if the commodity was damaged by the customer or prior to arriving. ABF advised that there was no sign of damage to the freight when loading.

item.title: Report X-2025031018
item.description:
Report X-2025031018

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-26T21:14:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: ATLANTA
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED ON SCENE TO FIND PACKAGE WAS LEAKING ONTO THE BELT. RESPONDER PUT CONTAINER INTO LINED SPILL TRAY AND USED ZEP ZORBENT ON LEAKED MATERIAL. AFTER CLEANING THE SCEEN, RESPONDER BROUGHT TRAY OF ZORBENT AND PACKAGE BACK TO DMP FOR PROCESSING.
